input_text:
Job Title: BI Data Analyst - AWS QuickSight

Location: Tempe, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, State Farm, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Overview

We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.

We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!

Visit our Careers page for more information on our , and of joining the State Farm team!

HYBRID: Qualified candidates (in or near hub locations listed below) should plan to spend time working from home and some time working in the office as part of our hybrid work environment. Enterprise Technology requires candidates to reside within 180 miles of the assigned office location.

HUB LOCATIONS: Dunwoody, GA; Richardson, TX; Tempe, AZ; or Bloomington, IL

SPONSORSHIP: Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity.

Responsibilities

Join our dynamic and innovative Enterprise Technology P&C Claims - Business Intelligence Team, where we are modernizing reporting solutions delivered to over 4,000 claims leaders and executives. As a member of our team, you will play a crucial role in coaching associates and empowering them to effectively manage their business.

As a member of our Product Team, you will have the opportunity to work with dashboarding, COGNOS, and emerging capabilities, ensuring that our reporting solutions are top-notch.

As we advance our modernization efforts, you will be part of our exciting migration to a new BI tool, leveraging the services of AWS QuickSight. This is an excellent opportunity to enhance your skills and expertise in cloud-based technologies while contributing to the success of our team. Additionally, you will be responsible for legislative and regulatory reporting for claims, ensuring compliance and transparency.

If you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are eager to be part of a team that is driving innovation, then we want you on our team. Join us and make a significant impact on our organization and the industry.

Qualifications

Competitive AWS QuickSight Developers will possess the following qualifications:

Knowledge of AWS: Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) is essential, including understanding the various AWS services, such as S3, Redshift, Athena, and IAM.Data Visualization Skills: Proficiency in data visualization concepts and techniques using AWS QuickSight.Strong understanding of SQL (Structured Query Language)Data Modeling concepts and techniques required. Python programming skillsPrior experience with BI tools such as Power BI, or QlikView will provide a good foundation for working with AWS QuickSight.AWS Developer Certification, a plus.

**Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g., H-1B visa) for this opportunity**

S

SFARM

BI Data Analyst - AWS QuickSight

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
